segments.text: so , how's your course going ? Do you like it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: i like my professors and the classes , but it's a lot of work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: right now , I'm doing some research into the languages of different African tribes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that sounds really interesting . Can you speak Swahili ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes , I learned how to speak it when I was little .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: really ? How did you do that ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: well , I grew up in Africa , so I learned quite a few different languages .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that's amazing . Are you doing well in your classes ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't know because I haven't received my test results yet .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: when did you take your exams ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: how do you think you did ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I left feeling pretty confident about my score , but I heard that my professors are very strict graders , so I'm a bit nervous .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm sure you'll do well . Did you study hard ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You know me ; I'm always studying !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: don't worry . If you don't do well , no one can !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thanks for the vote of confidence , Justin !
segments.speaker: S2
